010package imagingbook.common.util;
011
012import java.util.Iterator;
013
014/**
015 * This class implements a 1D map for arbitrary objects with flexible bottom and
016 * top index, similar to an array in Pascal. Containers are immutable (apart
017 * from element values).
018 * 
019 * @param <T> the container's element type
020 */
021public class LinearContainer<T> implements Iterable<T> {
022        
023        private final int botIndex, topIndex;
024        private final T[] data;
025        
026        /**
027         * Creates a LinearContainer with the index range [0, n - 1], like an ordinary
028         * array.
029         * 
030         * @param n size of the container.
031         */
032        public LinearContainer(int n) {
033                this(0, n - 1);
034        }
035        
036        /**
037         * Creates a LinearContainer with the index range [botIndex, topIndex].
038         * 
039         * @param botIndex bottom (smallest) index.
040         * @param topIndex top (largest) index.
041         */
042        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
043        public LinearContainer(int botIndex, int topIndex) {
044                if (botIndex > topIndex) {
045                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("LinearContainer: botIndex > topIndex");
046                }
047                this.botIndex = botIndex;
048                this.topIndex = topIndex;
049                int n = topIndex - botIndex + 1;
050                data = (T[]) new Object[n];
051        }
052        
053        /**
054         * Returns the k-th element of this container.
055         * 
056         * @param k the element index
057         * @return the k-th element
058         */
059        public T getElement(int k) {
060                // TODO: check for out-of-bounds index k
061                return data[k - botIndex];
062        }
063        
064        /**
065         * Sets (replaces) the k-th element of this container.
066         * 
067         * @param k    the element index
068         * @param elem the new element
069         */
070        public void setElement(int k, T elem) {
071                // TODO: check for out-of-bounds index k
072                data[k - botIndex] = elem;
073        }
074
075        /**
076         * Returns the bottom index of this container.
077         * 
078         * @return the bottom index
079         */
080        public int getBotIndex() {
081                return botIndex;
082        }
083        
084        /**
085         * Returns the top index of this container.
086         * 
087         * @return the top index
088         */
089        public int getTopIndex() {
090                return topIndex;
091        }
092
093        @Override
094        public Iterator<T> iterator() {
095                //return new ArrayIterator<T>(data);
096                return ArrayIterator.from(data);
097        }
098
099}
